courseDescription:
LAMP Stack (short for Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP/Perl/Python) is the best framework for facilitating fast web development. Do you want to be able to scale without experiencing downtime and deal with unexpected traffic peaks? This course better equips you to handle sudden spikes in website traffic and provide customers with stable online services. You will cover installing and setting up files such as vagrant and load balancer. Learn about the lamp stack architecture design to create websites and applications that are unique to you.

Next, you will learn the different types of scaling to set a system to handle the increase in demand without impacting the performance of an application. Learn how to connect the web server to applications and configure high availability for IP addresses. Discover the steps of creating high availability storage using GlusterFS and the key considerations in using the Cloud. Uncover the process of setting up the Percona XtraDB Cluster and how to use it for high availability.

After completing this course, you will deploy highly available web services and withstand single points of failure. Learn how to improve the infrastructure to accommodate an increasing number of users to the site. This course is suitable for anyone who would like to build a career as a web developer or start creating a sound design to repair any flaws quickly and effectively. Start learning LAMP Stack programming today!
